DESCRIPTION: Macallan 30 Year Old Sherry Oak which was matured exclusively in Jerez, Dry Oloroso Sherry Oak casks.

This is the follow-up to the iconic Macallan M, which for a time held the world record for the most expensive bottle of whisky ever sold when the six litre 'Imperiale' variant sold at auction in January 2014. 
The whisky itself was matured in sherry-seasoned oak casks, and the complexity and craftsmanship of the liquid is mirrored by the stunning Lalique black crystal decanter in which it is held. 
This is bottle number 437.

This super premium bottling from Bowmore distillery was laid down in 1973 and bottled at the lovely age of 43 years!
The bottle was released in 2016 and was from the last 6 bourbon hogsheads of 1973.
A great bottle from an even better distillery.

A highly desirable, limited-edition release from Macallan to commemorate the Golden Jubilee of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II (1952-2012). This is one of 2012 bottles. Drawn from its cask on the 8th of February 2012, by no coincidence the date of Her Majesty’s accession, this sherry cask-matured expression was bottled at 52% ABV.  It is an instant classic and highly collectable.

A highly desirable, limited-edition release from Macallan to commemorate the Golden Jubilee of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II (1952-2012). This is one of 2012 bottles.   Drawn from its cask on the 8th of February 2012, by no coincidence the date of Her Majesty’s accession, This sherry cask-matured expression was bottled at 52% ABV.  It is an instant classic and highly collectable.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 39 Year Old - Untold Stories: The Spirit Safe
DESCRIPTION:
This is an exciting release from the iconic Islay Distillery, Port Ellen. This limited edition has been produced from the original distillery's last remaining stocks and is the oldest of the original stock to ever be released. Set to re-open in 2021, Port Ellen was almost lost to history when it closed in 1983.
This special single malt has been matured for 39 years in American oak ex-bourbon casks and refill European sherry casks.  The release is limited to only 1,500 individually numbered bottles.   It comes presented in a stunning case complete with two sets of keys, in homage to the real spirit safe at the distillery.
This is bottle number 1,285.

This Macallan is very collectable and highly acclaimed.
It was distilled in 1967 but previously had been stored in sherry wood casks.
This 18 year old rare and collectable is hugely sought after.

Macallan 18-Year-Old first came to the whisky world in 1984. This vintage is from 1977.  The single malt has been matured for 18 years in Sherry Oak casks handpicked and made in Jerez, Spain.
Bottled around 1996, the packaging of this bottle is iconic - the purple sashed box features Sara Midda's lovely watercolours of the iconic Easter Elchies house.

This Macallan limited edition commemorates the 60th anniversary of Elizabeth II's coronation in 1953.  The Windsor red, blue and gold packaging was designed by David Holmes. 
The pack contains 2 x 35cl bottles:

Only just released on 01 August 2019 from specialist retailers, this is the seventeenth release of The GlenDronach Cask Bottling programme - European Edition.
It includes a rich selection of the distillery’s signature Pedro Ximénez and Oloroso sherry casks from Andalucía in Spain, as well as two Port pipes from the Douro Valley in Portugal. Collectors can also find a rare cask from 1995, one of the last remaining casks at the distillery from this vintage. 
In total just fourteen casks dating from 1990 to 2007 were personally selected by Master Blender, Dr Rachel Barrie, specially chosen for their exceptional character, to celebrate and share some of the finest examples of The GlenDronach’s richly-sherried Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky.
EUROPEAN ALLOCATED CASKS:7905, 221, 847, 5976, 325, 887, 6769
There are 7 further casks that have been allocated to APAC & Canada: 2623, 113, 5896, 416, 3040, 3343, 3359

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

Macallan 18 year old, distilled in 1980 was matured in Sherry wood casks at the heart of Speyside - Easter Elchies House. It was later bottled in 1999.  This is a rare and collectable bottle, highly sought-after by whisky enthusiasts.

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

The Macallan 1979 18 Year Old. Seen as a true classic from investors and connoisseurs alike, this Speyside gem was distilled in 1979 and bottled in 1997. Fully matured in Sherry Oak casks Jerez Spain.
The packaging is recognised all around the world with the watercolours from Sara Midda.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 1997 - 22 Year Old - Devil's Cask #666 - Hand Filled - Feis Ile 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is a very limited release and a very much surprise release by Bowmore for many during the 2019 Fèis Ìle.  It is a hand filled bottling from Devil's Cask #666, it was matured for 22 matured in a single sherry cask. 
 
This is bottle number 37 of just 240 released.

The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set comprising of Edition no. 1, 2, 3 and 4 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics. 
Edition No.1 - 48% - 70clEdition No.2 - 48.2% - 70clEdition No.3 - 48.3% - 70clEdition No.4 - 48.4% - 70cl

Originally released around the year 2000, this beautifully packaged Laphroig 30-year-old comes in a striking wooden presentation box.  It is an Islay gem that is becoming rarer and rarer.
Only a few releases from the distillery have been of an age older than this since its release. 
Awards include double Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.

Released as a distillery exclusive in 2017, this retro-style bottle from The Macallan is part of the Archival Series, recreating some of the distillery's vintage advertising campaigns. This second release in the series is matured in sherry casks for 12 years and bottled at 43% abv. Presented in a book-shaped tin case with an accompanying folio showcasing the watercolour artwork of Sara Midda. Only 2,000 bottles were produced and made available at the distillery.

The Macallan 25 Year Old Sherry Oak 2018 release is part of Macallan's super popular Sherry Oak range.  This 25 year old has been matured exclusively in hand-picked, sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez, Spain. 
An interesting fact about The Macallan’s curiously small spirit stills is that they are the smallest in Speyside. They have this unique size and shape to give the spirit maximum surface area contact with the copper.  This, in turn, helps to concentrate on the ‘new make’ spirit.  It will provide the viscosity and rich, fruity, full-bodied flavours so characteristic of The Macallan.

Bunnahabhain released three bottlings for 2019 Feis Ile on Islay. This is by far and away the most spectacular of the three, coming in at 30 years old. It comes with a 1cl tasting mini and in a beautiful leather case. One of the lighter whiskies on Islay, combined with this champagne cask is a recipe for success.
Distilled on 1st December 1988 and bottled on 17th May 2019.
One of only 120 bottles.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition, of which only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.
Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

Macallan Cask Strength bottlings are one of the most popular bottles in the history of whisky...arguably.
Bottled at full proof can also be understood to be 57%.

The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.
Macallan 25 Year Old Fine Oak from Macallan is matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 10 Year Old - Sherry Oak (6 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot consists of a case of Macallan 10 Year Old's (6 x 70cl).
Matured exclusively in oak sherry casks from Jerez in Spain.  This age statement was discontinued by Macallan in 2013.
All UK Duty Stamped.

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”
This is a 1-litre bottling of 12 year old single malt from Macallan, bottled in the 1980s. Very collectable indeed.

Distilled in 1994, after 24 years in a sherry hogshead, this expression yielded 294 bottles at 46.2% in 2019. Free from artificial colouring you can just tell this dram it is going to explode with Sherry!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 26 Year Old - Søren Solkær Photography
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunningly presented limited-edition single malt from Highland Park. This 26-year-old single malt has been made in collaboration with Danish photographer Soren Solker. Matured in a combination of sherry-seasoned American oak and first-fill bourbon casks, it is a rich, fruity whisky with notes of creamy vanilla.
This single malt comes presented in a limited-edition black leather look case, with a book containing 250 photographs by Soren Solker & Highland Park.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - A Final Act of Creation - 23 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This 23-year-old Bruichladdich, distilled in 1992 celebrates 'A Final Act of Creation' by Jim McEwan. 
Matured in his legendary 1992 Château Latour red wine cask for 23 years, dubbed "Princess Diana."  It was bottled in 2015 at 52% - in honour of his 52 years of distilling.
One of 220 bottles released.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 1990  - 28 Year Old Single Cask - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: This single cask release was exclusively available at Coal Ila's open day during Fèis Ìle 2019. It is one of just 180, hand-bottled by Distillery Manager, Pierrick Guillaume, who signed each one.  The single malt was distilled in September 1990, matured in cask #9373-159 for 28 years old and was bottled in May 2019.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 8 Year Old 2009 DCS Compendium Chapter 4
DESCRIPTION:
Part 4 of a 5 part release from Balvenie. This 2009 vintage named "DCS Compendium" is 8 Years Old.
This fourth release of Balvenie's five-part DCS Compendium, is a tribute to David Stewart, the renowned malt master.
Distilled: 7th April 2009
Bottled: 13th March 2018.
168 bottles coming from a single cask #2724.

This bottling was released in 2013 and was a very limited run.
Initially matured in American white oak before being transferred into a combination of Palomino Fino sherry butts and first-fill bourbon cask.
However, the Story of the Dalmore 25 doesn't quite stop there...it was then married together in bourbon barrels before a final finishing period in Tawny port pipes.

This Bowmore, 22 year old, single malt bottling has a rare blue ceramic bottle featuring two gulls and a stunning, lined presentation case to celebrate one of the legends of Bowmore.  The Gulls Legend is printed inside the lid of the presentation case:
'Legend has it that a pair of gulls fly ceaselessly above Loch Indaal, on the shores of which lies the Bowmore Distillery.
When the Scots spread from their Irish homeland to create the Kingdom of Dai Riada, the Pictish and Brythonic tribes who already occupied Scotland resisted fiercely. 
Cara, a daughter of Brude mae Maelchon, the Pictish King, fell in love with a captured Scottish warrior and helped him to escape. Together they fled westwards to Dai Raida. As they rowed towards the young warrior’s home on the shores of Loch Indaal, a terrible storm lashed their boat, sending it crashing against the rocks.
The young Scot’s clansmen found only splintered wreckage of the boat and no trace of the lovers. But a pair of white gulls soared and swooped together across the loch, settling neither on the western nor eastern shore, as if torn between the two.
This legend endures, and today, before a storm. the Bowmore Distillery echoes to the haunting cry of a pair of gulls.'

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.
This lot contains 6 x 70cl bottles.

This is one of only 3,000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release from the home of the legendary No. 1 Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Banff - 1966 - 34 Year Old - Signatory Vintage & 5cl - Silent Stills
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare bottle of Banff 1966 bottled in 2001 by Signatory for their Silent Stills series, which celebrates closed distilleries.  This single malt was matured in Butt No.3437 for 34 years.  This 70cl bottling comes beautifully presented in a wooden display box with a 5cl miniature and cask bung.  This is one of only 528 individually numbered bottles produced.
 
 
 
This is bottle number 5.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.

Redbreast 20 Year Old Dream Cask 50cl / Pedro Ximenez Edition.  This whisky is from a single Pedro Ximénez cask, number 374932.
Four different single pot-still whiskies make up this 20 year old expression from the Midleton Distillery. 
This sold out in just 14 minutes...be sure to place your bid to catch this beauty today!
One of 924 bottles.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release from the home of the legendary No. 1 Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number 0883.

Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include the Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

Glendronach Grandeur 27 Year Old Batch 10
Exclusively matured in Sherry oak casks for 27 years this beautifully presented bottle is part of the Grandeur series by the Highland distillery.
Only 2293 bottles produced making this a great item for collectors.

Hard to find in the UK, as only 24 of the 437 bottles of cask #2623 bottled for Asia, Australia, Canada & New Zealand, were released at the distillery.
This cask is part of the seventeenth release of The GlenDronach’s acclaimed Cask Bottling programme, which celebrates some of the distillery’s richly-sherried Highland Single Malt. Each expression has been bottled from a single cask.
This 28 year old was distilled in July 1990, matured in Oloroso sherry butt cask number 2623 and was bottled in 2019 at 50.1% ABV. 
This is bottle Number 22 of 437.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 8 x 70cl + 1 x 1L (Import)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series (8x 70cl) plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition (1L).  Note: duty stamp on any of set.
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus also the Night's Watch guard. 
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelThis lot contains 8 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.
Johnnie Walker White Walker - 41.7% - 1L

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release from the home of the legendary No. 1 Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number 0885.

This special Bowmore bottling was distilled and bottled to commemorate the European Fly Fishing Championships 8th - 12th September 2003.  It is a limited edition, presented by Morrison Bowmore Distillers Ltd.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1984 - 32 Year Old  - Rare Cask Series - Bourbon
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2008, Jim McEwan identified a classic vintage that celebrated style and re-casked it into fresh bourbon for the last leg of an epic journey. This dram comes from the very last 12 casks of the 1984 legacy distillation, poignantly filled on 31st December of that year.  This is one of only 3,000 bottles produced. 
This is bottle number 2,170.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1986 30 Year Old - Rare Cask Series - Magnificent Seven
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition 30 year old by Bruichladdich is part of their Rare Cask Series. The single malt was distilled in 1986 and filled into Oloroso Sherry butts, then moved over to Pedro Ximenéz butts from winemaker Jan Pettersen at bodega Fernando de Castilla by previous Master Distiller Jim McEwan in 2012 for the rest of its maturation.
The Magnificent Seven was drawn from just 7 casks, producing 4,200 bottles.
This is bottle number 3,816.

This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles meaning there is limited opportunity to buy and taste this much sought after whisky. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies.
 
This is bottle number 78.

William Larue Weller 2018 annual Release.  This has most certainly been worth waiting for...
William Larue Weller, born in the 19th century was a whiskey rectifier and distiller. The distillery and company were run by another hugely famous man within the industry... Julian Van Winkle.  His nickname is of course Pappy.
This is one of approximately 17,179 bottles. They were picked from 149 barrels. This 2018 expression has been aged for 12 years and won whisky of the year 2019 in the Whisky Bible.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich -  32 Year Old 1985 - Rare Cask Series - Hidden Glory
DESCRIPTION:
This 32 year old Bruichladdich 'Hidden Glory' has a charming history - it was made from the final 22 casks from 1985.  The casks were rediscovered in 2012 by then master distiller Jim McEwan, who filled their spirit into fresh bourbon barrels for added depth and complexity.
In 2017 the whisky was then transferred again, this time into French oak which had previously held claret from a prestigious chateau. This three month period imbued the bourbon-aged whisky with an extra layer of fruity and sweet notes, as well as a subtle blush colour. 4,200 bottles were produced.
 
This is bottle number 3,309.

Highland Park Bicentenary celebration was in the year 1998 and this special bottling, distilled in 1977 was bottled as part of the celebrations.
This bottle of 21 year old single malt is one of only 15,000 bottles produced.
This is number 12,372.

The 1841 Replica is the third is a series of replicas from Macallan which was released in 2003 following the 1861 and 1874 reproductions.
These antique-esque pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

Now discontinued, this Japanese 15 year old is becoming sought after by collectors. Distilled at Yoichi, the first distillery founded by Nikka founder Masataka Taketsuru in 1934, this Japanese single malt was at 45% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - Douglas Laing 70th Anniversary XOP 1993
DESCRIPTION:
From Douglas Laing's Xtra Old Particular single cask series, comes this independent bottling from Glen Garioch.
In 2003 XOP was launched and would be their flagship bottlings.
Distillation date: July 1993 and matured in a Sherry hogshead for 25 years.
Bottling date: August 2018

Convalmore is arguably one of the finest drams Speyside has ever produced. The distillery was closed by Diageo in which shut its doors in 1985. It is now owned by Wm Grants but used for storage only.  This is an opportunity to grab yourself a bit of history in this bottle as it is a very infrequently-seen Convalmore bottled in 2015 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Rare Old range.

A blend of famous whiskies released every year since 1984. Each bottle is numbered individually and signed by the master distiller Barry Crockett. 2012 was the year he decided to retire and to honour him they release Barry Crockett legacy. This whisky has been aged for a maximum of 25 years and a minimum of 12 years in Bourbon casks only.

The Sanmi-Ittai single cask pure malt whiskies are rare expressions from Toashuzo Co.
The same company who aimed to revive the skills and flavours of the Hanyu distillery.
Two single casks expressions here, both being 1st editions. It has the potential to be a good investment whisky for the future.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 25 Year Old (1991) - Yellow Submarine WDMIII - The Legend Resurfaces
DESCRIPTION:
The Bruichladdich 25 Year Old Yellow Submarine, WMD III (Whisky of Mass Destruction III) The Legend Resurfaces is a 25 year old, single malt that has been matured in Refill Sherry & Bourbon, Spanish red wine casks.
This is the third release in the series that was created as a tribute to the early days at Bruichladdich; while searching through eBay back in 2016 Bruichladdich discovered a yellow submarine for sale that was identical to the bright yellow Royal Navy Submersible that Islay fisherman John Baker landed back in 2005 - Bruichladdich had to have it. 
To celebrate this find, Head Distiller Adam Hannett hunted out the of the original 1991 spirit which is now an incredible 25 years old and presented it as "WMD III The Legend Resurfaces".  This is one of only 1,991 individual numbered bottles available.

This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles meaning there is limited opportunity to buy and taste this much sought after whisky. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies.

This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles meaning there is limited opportunity to buy and taste this much sought after whisky. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Steven Klein
DESCRIPTION:
Released exclusively for travel retail, uniquely, Rare Cask Black has been crafted from first fill Spanish and American sherry seasoned oak casks from less than 100 casks.  This yielded 5,000 bottles of a more peated spirit.
This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles meaning there is limited opportunity to buy and taste this much sought after whisky. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies.
This is an older style of bottling of the famous Macallan 10-year-old malt whisky. It comes presented in the all-white box showing Easter Elchies House,  which is increasingly hard to find.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

Macallan Boutique Collection 2016 Release was released in Taiwan as a duty-free exclusive to celebrate the opening of their first boutique back in 2016.
This bottling is made from a variety of different casks and one for the collectors.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

The 18462 Replica is part of a series of replicas from Macallan which was released following the 1861 and before 1874 reproductions.
These antique pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

This Macallan Boutique Collection, 2019 release was created to mark the launch of The Macallan Boutique programme. Newly released in June 2019, the new expression is exclusively available in the Boutique locations.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

Cardhu managers dram, 15 years old. A refill cask whisky specially selected and bottled at natural strength for all the S.M.D Staff Association.
Bottled in 1989 at 63% Vol.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

This eyecatching Macallan Replica was modelled on a bottle from the Victorian era. This is the second release in the Replica range and is said to be inspired by the discovery of two pre-20th century casks of Macallan. It is rich in summer fruits, both fresh/citric and dried, with traces of spice. Light vanilla fudge, sweet oak and wood spice.  This bottle comes in a presentation box, with a stunning red velvety lining.

Ardbeg Twenty One came from a Bourbon cask and matured for 21 years. In 2016 the fan club got the opportunity to purchase this committee release. They most certainly won't be disappointed if they grabbed that opportunity with both hands!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 21 Year Old Single Cask - Oloroso Sherry

DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

This is an increasingly hard to find bottling, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery.   It is a classic lowland malt and is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson.  Rosebank produced some of the most beautiful and delicate whiskies and this is true of this summery dram.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.

Glenfiddich 1995 1st Fill Bourbon Barrel bottled for the Spirit of Speyside 2018.
Each label is hand written for the 199 bottles produced from this exclusive hand-fill bottling at the Glenfiddich distillery in 2018.
1995 was the year of distilation and matured in a single 1st fill bourbon barrel (cask number #15836).
The whisky was chosen by Glenfiddich's Malt Master, Mr Brian Kinsman.

2019 was launched to celebrate the heritage of the Macallan estate.
All of the whisky contained within this stunning presentation box is grown locally on the estate, which is quite unusual because the barley would normally be reserved for some of their more upmarket bottlings.
The Macallan Estate 2019

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Madrid & Barcelona
DESCRIPTION:
A twin pack of Johnnie Walker Blue label. Barcelona and Madrid limited editions.
Both designs feature unique detailing on the box of the cities.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 21 Year Old - Black Art - Edition 2.2
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second release from Bruichladdich in the Black Art Series and it is just as mysterious as the first release.  Distilled in 1989, this 21 Year Old is labelled Edition 2.2.
American and European Oak wines casks were used in this lovely bottling. An expression in the Black Art series is now released annually as part of the core range.

A hard to find 7 Year Old Armando Giovinetti Special Selection from the 1990s. This bottling was specially produced for Giovinetti and Figli, the Italian wine and spirits company.
Armando Giovinetti, famous among the whisky community, has often been known as the main link between Scotland and Itlay long-lasting history when it comes to single malts.
Sara Midda artistic flair has been used on the label and was painted during a visit to the distillery. Both people related to the distillery at this time.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

Cask Number 160/5086

Blair Athol 15 Year Old Manager's Dram from 1996. Bottled as part of the series of what is now known as Diageo.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. 
This expression was bottled in 1996 by distillery manager Gordon Donoghue.

Bottled in the mid-1990s, this 23 year old 1972 Teaninich is one of the highlights of the Rare Malt series.  It was bottled at a collosal 64.95%.
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.
 
This bottle is a US Import and is bottle number 666...

The Chairman's Release is considered the flagship of Macallan's 1700 series. The series takes its name from the year that Easter Elchies House, the home of The Macallan, was built.
Bottled in 2001, The Chairman's Release single malt is held in an elegant flint gicel glass bottle.  
This bottle is an import.

This 18 year old Mannochmore is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This malt was matured in refill casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 66% ABV.  It is one of just 1800 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 25 Year Old 1990 -  Sherry Cask - Rare Cask Series
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich's 1990/25 is a 25 year old single malt distilled in 1990 (hence the name). This expression comes from the marriage of whisky from two differing  Bruichladdich maturation process. 
Batch 1:
Batch 2:
It was produced in collaboration with winemaker Jan Pettersen and was originally released for the Travel Retail market. This is one of only 6,000 produced.

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

A whisky steeped in history, heritage and quality – Glenfiddich Excellence 26 Year Old was created to honour the distillery’s continuous line of family ownership since William Grant founded it in 1887. A rare single malt that has spent 26 years maturing in American ex-bourbon casks.
ged exclusively in ex-bourbon casks from Kentucky’s Kelvin Cooperage, the Speysider is the first of the distiller’s ongoing bourbon cask editions. Formidably fruity but well-balanced with oak spice, this is one for Glenfiddich diehards.

Murray Mcdavid brought this distillery back to life in 2000 after it was closed by Whyte and Mackay. Jim McEwan has been instrumental in building this brand up from the ground. He has been hugely successful in his extrovert ideas with regards to cask management, quirky bottle colours, heavily HEAVILY peated malts and now they are even making Gin too!
The story behind this bottle is that one day a fisherman came across a small yellow submarine. The ministry of defence denied any connection with it of course and so did the Beatles...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 27 Year Old - Rare Cask Series - HB '90
DESCRIPTION:
One for the sherry lovers, this bottling is part of the Rare Cask Series by Bruichladdich. 
Distilled by an earlier generation of Bruichladdich Stillmen, this unpeated Bruichladdich spirit lay untouched in Bruichladdich's loch-side warehouses for 17 years.  In 2007 the whisky was then transferred into French oak casks from Bordeaux for the final decade of maturation before being bottled at cask strength.
This is one of just 12,000 individually numbered bottles originally released exclusively for Global Travel Retail.
This bottle number 274.

Laphroaig 25 Year Old Cask Strength 2017 Edition is an unlikely combination of whisky that has been aged in second-fill European oak Oloroso sherry casks and American white oak bourbon. 
The bottling is non-chilled filtered, with notes of classic Islay peat complemented by oak, sherried sweetness and spice.
This annual cask strength has been bottled at 48.9%.
Lagavulin 1990 Distillers Edition was finished in Pedro Ximenez cask wood.  It was bottled in 2006 at 43% ABV.  Lagavulin is the most sought after bottling of the Distiller’s Edition range.

This was the first in the prestigious 'Private Editon' bottlings by Glenmorangie Distillery.  After 10 years maturing in American white oak casks this whisky was transferred into Spanish ex-Pedro Ximenez (PX) casks for its final two years of extra-maturation. Carefully selected, limited edition whiskies were chosen from the 'cabinet of curiosities' of Dr Bill Lumsden, head of the Glenmorangie Whisky Creation Team.

Aberfeldy 1999 - Hand Filled Cask #20658
A dark single cask that could only be bought at the distillery and hand-filled from Aberfeldy distillery.
Distilled in 1999 and bottled at the distillery from cask #20658

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 30 Year Old (1974) - Rare Malts
DESCRIPTION:
This Rare Malts Selection bottling of single malt whisky from the Royal Lochnagar distillery is highly collectable. It was distilled in 1974 and bottled 30 years later in 2004, and bottled at its cask strength of 56.2% ABV.
The Rare Malts Selection was created in 1995 consisting of bottlings predominantly from closed distilleries, distilled in the late 60s, 70s or early 80s and aged for at least 18 years. The success of the range culminated in the creation of an annual Special Releases range in 2001.
This is bottle number 5038.

This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

This bottling is a follow on from the very popular Tun 1401 series by The Balvenie Distillery, which had 9 batches.
Due to the success of Tun 1401, Balvenie used a bigger tun - Tun 1509 could hold four times as much liquid.  Seven European oak Sherry butts and thirty-five American oak barrels were used and were married together for several months each.  This bottle also comes with a diagram that details the main tasting characteristics of each of these 43 casks. 
This is the first batch of Balvenie's Tun 1509 single malt Scotch whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich -  22 Year Old-  Black Art - Edition 3.1
DESCRIPTION:
This is the third release from Bruichladdich in the Black Art Series and mystery lives on.  The recipe is kept a strict secret and the bottle features the arcane symbols seen on earlier releases. Distilled in 1989, this 22 Year Old is labelled Edition 3.1. American and European Oak wines casks were used in this lovely bottling.
An expression in the Black Art series is now released annually, as part of Bruichladdich's core range.

This stunning bottle is the third part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection and was released in 2013.
Freya is a 15 year old single malt named after the Norse Goddess associated with fertility, wealth and war.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 19,000 bottles of Freya.

This single malt was released by Glenmorangie in 2013 as part of their prestigious  Private Edition range - this was the 4th release in the series. 
Bottled in 2012 and distilled in 1993 the Ealanta was matured fully in virgin American white oak casks. These casks were special due to their heavily charred oak which came from a forest in Missouri. This is how it largely differs from its predecessors as it has been full-term matured opposed to just finished in 'designer' casks.
Awards include:

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Edition No.4, Limited Edition Paolo Pellegrin Print, Glasses & Hip flask - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery.  T
This limited edition of Macallan - Edition No.4 also contains a signed, limited edition distillery print by Magnum Photographer Paolo Pellegrin
This lot includes a gift set of 2 x branded Macallan whisky glasses and a distillery exclusive hipflask. It also comes with a Macallan tote bag.
One of just 3000 this 20th Anniversary bottling of Benromach is to commemorate Gordon and MacPhail taking over this nearly abandoned distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Spirit of Speyside 2019 - 15 year old
DESCRIPTION:
This is a distillery exclusive, released for the Spirit of Speyside Festival 2019.  It is a single cask bottling that has been matured exclusively for 15 years in a port pipe - in cask no. 30498.  It is a limited edition - there are 400 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 152 of 400 indiviudally numbered bottles.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.
This is bottle nymber 0426

An earlier version of Hibiki by Suntory. What would eventually become their signature style this bottle was used to test the market.
This early bottling and shape are getting rarer as people snap up the early editions.

The Macallan Ruby from the 1824 series. Other bottles include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The 2004 release of the Glen Ord 25 Year Old follows on from the 30-year-old release.
3,600 bottles were produced, all at cask strength.
A great representation of the North Highland Malts described as being full of flavour with smoky-sweet, spicy with a crisp finish. Jim Murray awarded this whisky 95 points in his Whisky Bible.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

This was the third release from Daftmill, a family (The Cuthbert's) owned and operated seasonal distillery located in Fife.  Granted a license on St Andrews Day 2005, first distillation took place in December 2005.  
This is a limited edition Winter batch release which was distilled shortly after opening in 2006.  It is one of only 1,625 bottles and is made up of whisky from 6 first fill Bourbon barrels.

This is the fourth release of the legendary Bruichladdich Black Art. Former Master Distiller Jim McEwan has kept the composition of this whisky as enigmatic as ever.  Distilled in 1990, the composition of the casks is a mystery to everyone but the creator himself, using the very finest American and French oak and bottled 23 long years later in the true Bruichladdich artisan style.

Linkwood Managers dram chosen in 1999 on the 1st of December. This 12 year old was matured in a refill sherry cask chosen by Harry Fox, the distillery manager at the time.
 
This is bottle number 1436

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 23 Year Old - Black Art 1990 - Edition 4.1
DESCRIPTION: This fourth incarnation of the now legendary Black Art is as enigmatic as ever, the composition of casks a mystery to all but its creator. Working with the very finest American and French oak to explore that most esoteric relationship between spirit and wood, Black Art 4 is Master Distiller Jim McEwan’s personal voyage into the heart of Bruichladdich.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Albyn - 1972 - 1994 Connoisseurs Choice - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling of Glen Albyn was distilled in 1972 and bottled in 1994 for the Connoisseur's Choice by Gordon & MacPhail.   
Glen Albyn is a closed and now demolished distillery in Inverness.  Their licence was awarded in 1847, but the distillery ran into difficulties and fell silent in 1855.

The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'
This is bottle number 3457.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Port Ellen Special Blend
DESCRIPTION:
This limited release of Johnnie Walker's most premium brand which focuses on both lost and active distilleries.
Given that Brora shut its doors in 1983, we're talking about whisky that was distilled at least 35 years ago!
“Whiskies from these ghost distilleries are becoming increasingly rare. From our library of irreplaceable casks that we keep exclusively for Johnnie Walker Blue Label, I've chosen a few uniquely full-bodied expressions of these precious malts and grains to let people explore, in a new way, the extraordinary richness found in our pinnacle whisky.” Jim Beveridge

This 2007 Fèis Ìle Bottling was distilled in February 2000.  It was matured in a fresh Sherry cask in Warehouse No.5 for 7 years. This is one of just 700 bottles released.
This is bottle number 32.

This is the second release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series.  It contains whisky drawn from just 50 sherry butts to craft a rich and fruity dram. 
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - 20 Year Old - Cask Strength (Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
This 20 year old Dalwhinnie was distilled in 1986, matured in refill European oak casks and bottled at the cask strength of  56.8% ABV in 2006. This is a limited release of 5358 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 03848.

This is the third release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series. 
Created to show the complexity and depth that can be achieved through aging, Rare Cask comes from a broad selection of casks, including American oak sherry casks and European oak casks – a large number of which are first-fill.
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

The Macallan Ruby from the 1824 series. Other bottles include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The Macallan Ruby from the 1824 series. Other bottles include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

This is the third release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series. 
Created to show the complexity and depth that can be achieved through ageing, Rare Cask comes from a broad selection of casks, including American oak sherry casks and European oak casks – a large number of which are first-fill.

The Macallan Estate Reserve forms part of The Macallan 1824 Collection and is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.  
 
This lot includes a miniature version of the full 70cl bottle. The full-size bottles case opens in an unusual way in comparison to the normal 1824 collection.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Spirit of Speyside 2019 - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
This is a distillery exclusive, released for the Spirit of Speyside Festival 2019.  It is a single cask bottling that has been matured exclusively for 15 years in a port pipe - in cask no. 30498.  It is a limited edition - there are 400 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 30.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Spirit of Speyside 2019 - 15 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
