This is bottle number 25.

This limited edition 2016 Committee Release of Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   Punchier than the standard release, this has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

This limited edition 2016 Committee Release of Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   Punchier than the standard release, this has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles.  It is a peated malt that was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japan's whisky industry by building Chichibu Distillery.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

This bottling is a single cask Isle of Jura to celebrate William Delme Evans - the former Jura distillery manager who laid plans for the new distillery in 1958.
This is the 1st edition of this series and this is one of only 757 bottles produced.  The single malt was distilled on the 1st of Nov 1988 and was matured in cask No# 1790.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Edition No.4 - Paolo Pellegrin Print.
DESCRIPTION:
The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery.  T
This limited edition of Macallan - Edition No.4 also contains a signed, limited edition distillery print by Magnum Photographer Paolo Pellegrin
This lot includes a gift set of 2 x branded Macallan whisky glasses and a distillery exclusive hipflask. It also comes with a Macallan tote bag.

In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.
There is a paid of copper stills manufactured by Foryths of Rothes, Scotland. 
This was a limited release and a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at cask strength.

The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

Port Charlotte PC5, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit.  It was the first release of heavily peated Port Charlotte and was produced in 2001 from some of the first spirits to be produced after the distillery's reopening.  The single malt was bottled at 5 years old in 2006 and was limited to 6038 bottles.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929. 
 
This is bottle number 3693.

Only 3250 of these bottles were produced and were given to staff working for Ederington at the time to celebrate the 150th year for the company. 
A 33 year old blend of malts from all across the country.
This bottle is the same shape for cognac and has been long since discontinued making it a collectable item. This 10-year-old from Speyside was labelled the founder's reserve.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Dark
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2017, 'The Dark' is first in the Highland Park series that celebrates the seasons on the Isle of Orkney, where Highland Park is made. The Dark is a 17-year-old single malt that has been matured in sherry casks, giving it aromas of dried fruits, nuts and herbs combined with smoky peat to as a nod to the autumn and winter seasons of Orkney.  The Light followed in 2018 symbolising spring and summer. 
The Dark is a limited release 28,000.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.
This bottle is the same shape for cognac and has been long since discontinued making it a collectable item. This 10-year-old from Speyside was labelled the Founder's Reserve.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

Bruichladdich Fino Sherry is part of the Bruichladdich sherry finished range. This 1992 vintage single malt was allowed a finishing period in Pedro Ximinez.  This 17 year old was released in 2009. It is one of 6,000 bottles.
 
 
 
 
This is bottle number 7.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1986 La Maison du Whisky - 50th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This is a rare vintage 1986 Bruichladdich Islay single malt Scotch Whisky bottled in celebration of the 50th anniversary of La Maison Du Whisky.  It was aged for 19 years in first-fill Sherry Butt with Cask number 2 from the year 2005. This is a limited edition bottling of only 690 individually numbered bottles.
It is a first-class Bruichladdich Islay single malt in memory of LMDW by Master Distiller Jim McEwan.
This is bottle number 366.

This Macallan 12 Year Old Elegancia was matured in both Oloroso and Fino sherry casks. 
Originally released to the travel retail market, it was typically found in duty-free.  This bottling is 1 Litre in size.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Heretic, 2001 has been named 'The Last of the First' as the limited release of 1300 bottles was from the last five casks from Port Charlotte’s first year of distillation in 2001. Adam Hannett, Head Distiller carefully married these five casks which previously held either American whiskey, rum or fine French wine. 
This was a limited edition, Feis Ile 2018, Distillery exclusive release from Bruichladdich Distillery. 
 
This is bottle number 0518.
Macallan 12 Year Old Elegancia was matured in both Oloroso and Fino sherry casks. It was originally released to the travel retail market - this is a 1 litre bottling.

The Macallan Rare Cask is comprised of 16 different sherry-cask styles, the majority of which are first fill.  Rich and complex with notes of dark honey and dried fruit, this bridges the gap between The 1824 Series and The 1824 Collection.
This is a US import.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 13 Year Old Distillery Exclusive - Oloroso Cask
Highland Park - 18 Year Old - Single Cask #2865 - Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION: This 18 year old single cask release from Highland Park was matured in an American Oak Butt.  This is a limited edition of only 606 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Dark
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2017, 'The Dark' is first in the Highland Park series that celebrates the seasons on the Isle of Orkney, where Highland Park is made. The Dark is a 17-year-old single malt that has been matured in sherry casks, giving it aromas of dried fruits, nuts and herbs combined with smoky peat to as a nod to the autumn and winter seasons of Orkney.  The Light followed in 2018 symbolising spring and summer. 
The Dark is a limited release 28,000.

Duncan Taylors Cask strength Single Malt from The Macallan Distillery.   A very exclusive bottle, number 2 of 266 bottles total matured in Oak Casks.
Distilled in 1990 and bottled in 08.2009.
This is bottle number 2 of 266 individually numbered bottles.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore 6.3 - 5 Year Old-  2009 - Islay Barley
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2014, Octomore 06.3 Islay Barley was made with barley grown on Islay from 'Lorgba' field on Octomore Farm.  This limited edition 2009, is true to the character of Bruichladdich's Octomore expressions - it is very heavily peated with 258 PPM.  It is a very flavoursome 5 year old single malt, created with depth, elegance and a tasty dose of peat!

This special malt combined tradition with innovation at the Bunnahabhain distillery. Senior blender, Dr Kirstie MaCallum has chosen to finish an exquisite 9 Year Old malt in Portuguese Port Pipes. 
Bottled at cask strength this limited release is one to snatch up quickly!

This is the fifth release from Bruichladdich in the Black Art Series and it is just as mysterious as the first release even with Adam Hannett at the helm following Jim McEwan's retirement. Distilled in 1992 and aged for 24 years, this edition is labelled Edition 05.1.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1983 Valinch - '1st Anniversary of the Re-opening'
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask bottling is from cask no.1330 - a fresh Oloroso Sherry Butt.  Distilled in 1983, the single malt was bottled in May 2002 to 'commemorate the first anniversary if Bruichladdich Distillery.'  This cask from Warehouse No.2 was selected by Master Blended Jim McEwan to celebrate the historic day.
This is bottle number 292 of 826 individually numbered bottles.
This limited edition Bunnahabhain distillery was fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks, revealing a side of the distillery not often seen. It has been bottled at the cask strength of 60.1 % ABV.

Bowmore - Virgin Oak - Fèis Ìle 2015 
A festival release from Fèis Ìle 2015 of 1,000 bottles matured in selected virgin oak casks and bottled at natural strength. 
This is bottle number 134 of 1000 individually numbered bottles.

The Macallan Rare Cask is comprised of 16 different sherry-cask styles, the majority of which are first fill.  Rich and complex with notes of dark honey and dried fruit, this bridges the gap between The 1824 Series and The 1824 Collection.
This a rare and very collectable bottle of Aberfeldy 15 Year Old, that is estimated to have been bottled in the 1980s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 17 Year Old - The Light
DESCRIPTION: Highland Park 'The Light' is a 17 year old single malt inspired by spring and summer on Orkney, released in 2018.  It is the follow up to the Highland Park 2017 release in the series - 'The Dark'.  The Light is a fresh and zesty Highland Park expression, that has been matured in refill American oak casks giving it notes of pear, vanilla and soft spice.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads. This is a Spanish import.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

This 12 year old Dalwhinnie is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases.  The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.5%.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
The result is 1710 bottles of rich, oaky single malt, with notes of dark chocolate and treacle toffee.
This is bottle number 0573.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Sherry Cask - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of just 3000 bottles in this release by Bowmore which was sold exclusively at the distillery, during Fèis Ìle 2018.  This single malt has been matured exclusively in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks for 15 years.  It was bottled at the cask strength of 52.5% ABV.
 
 
This is bottle number 0166.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Limited Release - Pedro Ximénez Finish (Import)
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition bottling from the Bunnahabhain distillery on the north-east coast of Islay. This is a 14 year old single malt, distilled in 2003 and was initially aged in second-fill Sherry casks until 2011. At this point, the whisky was transferred over to yet more Sherry casks - first-fill Pedro Ximénez casks! It was bottled in 2017 at cask strength. This is one of individually numbered 6768 bottles.  This bottle is an import.
This is bottle number 5775.
This version of the Caol Ila 25 year old was introduced in 2010, after cask strength versions in 2004 and 2005.  It was the first officially-bottled Caol Ila 25yo to be bottled at 43%.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

This stunning Highland Park 15 year old single malt follows the 'Ice' edition to complete this Highland Park two-part series. The 'Fire' edition celebrates Muspelheim, the glowing Norse fire realm of destruction.  The malt was matured in refill Port casks and bottled at 45.2% abv. It's presented in a cradle shaped like a mountain.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Limited Release - Pedro Ximénez Finish (Import)
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition bottling from the Bunnahabhain distillery on the north-east coast of Islay. This is a 14 year old single malt, distilled in 2003 and was initially aged in second-fill Sherry casks until 2011. At this point, the whisky was transferred over to yet more Sherry casks - first-fill Pedro Ximénez casks! It was bottled in 2017 at cask strength. This is one of individually numbered 6768 bottles.  This bottle is an import.
This is bottle number 5829.

'Companta' by Glenmorangie, follows on from 'Ealanta', which was named as World Whisky of the Year 2014 by Jim Murray. 'This Private Edition Companta was a very popular release, selling out quickly from most retailers.
After first maturing in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, the Companta was matured in 60% Burgundy wine casks from Clos de Tart and 40% Rhône Valley casks that previously held Rasteau, sourced by Glenmorangie's Director of Distilling, Dr. Bill Lumsden.
The result is an exceedingly well-made cherry red, non-chill-filtered single malt that fits perfectly into the continuing range of experimental releases from Glenmorangie.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Limited Release - Pedro Ximénez Finish (Import)
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition bottling from the Bunnahabhain distillery on the north-east coast of Islay. This is a 14 year old single malt, distilled in 2003 and was initially aged in second-fill Sherry casks until 2011. At this point, the whisky was transferred over to yet more Sherry casks - first-fill Pedro Ximénez casks! It was bottled in 2017 at cask strength. This is one of individually numbered 6768 bottles.  This bottle is an import.
This is bottle number 5800.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2003 - Limited Release - Pedro Ximénez Finish (Import)
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition bottling from the Bunnahabhain distillery on the north-east coast of Islay. This is a 14 year old single malt, distilled in 2003 and was initially aged in second-fill Sherry casks until 2011. At this point, the whisky was transferred over to yet more Sherry casks - first-fill Pedro Ximénez casks! It was bottled in 2017 at cask strength. This is one of individually numbered 6768 bottles.  This bottle is an import.
This is bottle number 5859.

This is an exceptional 1996 vintage said to have a voluptuous cassis fruit and it is a blockbuster to enjoy now but will improve with age. Blended mostly from Cabernet Sauvignon, it combines structure and finesse, elegance and longevity.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - Rubha A'Mhail - Fèis Ìle 2015
DESCRIPTION: Bunnahabhain Rubha A’ Mhail is a 11-year old Bunnahabhain which was bottled for the 2015 Fèis Ìle. Aged in two Spanish Manzanilla sherry butts (#550 & #554) this is a limited edition of 1,200 individually numbered bottles.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

Glen Ord Distillery is just outside the small town of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
It was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

This single cask edition from Scapa distillery was distilled on the 22nd of March 2006.  It was then bottled from a single first fill, sherry butt on the 30th July 2018.  This is one of only 828 bottles, which were only originally available to purchase from the distillery.
 
This is bottle number 744.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

This is a 21 year old single malt from Bruichladdich, released as part of its Micro-Provenance Series, which showed off a number of single cask whiskies aged in a variety of casks. A single Bourbon cask was filled on the 3rd of February 1994 - It was then transferred to a Sauternes cask before bottling on the 4th of November 2015. Only 253 bottles were produced.
The Micro Provenance web exclusive range comprises an exploratory series of single cask bottlings, hand-selected by Jim McEwan & Adam Hannett to showcase the complexity and pedigree of individual casks.
This is bottle number 105.

The 2017 Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival expression was matured in a combination of refill American oak hogsheads and first-fill American oak barrels.  It’s described as a sweet and typically peaty expression, with ‘hints of almonds, brazil nuts, pears and smoked ham’.
This is a limited edition release of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2049.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 1989 Valinch - Re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling from Bruichladdich was distilled in 1986 and bottled from a single refill sherry cask #160. It was originally only available at Bruichladdich Distillery, released in continuation of the re-opening of Bruichladdich Distillery.  This is one of only 300 50cl bottles.
 
 
This is bottle number 153.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Pittyvaich - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 12-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the Flora and Fauna series.
In the 1990's Diageo created the Flora and Fauna series. Some bottles are, as usual, harder to come by than others.  As it only operated from 1974 until 1993 there is only a very small number of bottlings of their spirit available.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Strathmill - 25 Year Old - XOP - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION:
A limited release of only 209 bottles. Douglas Laing has specially selected this single cask 'XOP - Xtra Old Particular.'
This is a 25 year old single malt from the Strathmill distillery in Speyside, matured in one refill hogshead cask #11068 from December 1990 to February 2016, before being bottled by Douglas Laing at the cask strength of 47.4%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 21 Year Old - Reserva Rum Cask
DESCRIPTION: The Glenfiddich 21 Year Old has been finished in casks used previously to age Caribbean Rum. This is an unusual finish from Glenfiddich here with an older expression. Described as exotic, rich and sweet dram.  Great for a Glenfiddich collector.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series. 
It was partially matured in European oak.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old (Signed Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Parks last batch of the 18 Year Old single malt before the new packaging of the 18 Year Old Viking Pride.
756 bottles were hand signed by Whisky Makers Max McFarlane and Gordon Motion.

This is a rare, 15 year old Highland single malt from the now-closed Glen Mhor distillery, bottled by Gordon & MacPhail. This bottling is part of their Distillery Labels series. 
Glen Mhor closed their doors in 1983 and the distillery was demolished three years later.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 11 Year Old - 2007 French Brandy Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Most of the whisky coming from the distillery prior to 2012 was lightly peated. However, in 2012 a change was to come...
Approximately 20% of production contains 35-45ppm peat.
A limited release from warehouse number 8 and distilled in 2007. This beauty is finished in a French Brandy Cask.

Bruichladdich Fino Sherry was the 4th and final bottle in the Bruichladdich sherry finished range.  It was distilled in 1992 matured for 17 years in Fino floor butts from Bodegas Rey Fernando de Castilla and was bottled in 2009.  This is one of 6000 bottles released.

Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood certainly holds its own in the core range. 
It lives up to its name having an additional period of maturation in 30 year-old port pipes.

This Distillery Exclusive handful was drawn from a 'Culag' cask.  The single mat has been matured for 18 years, including a finish in a Cognac cask.
It was bottled by hand on the 24th of May 2019.
This label does not include bottle number.

One of 224, bottled in 2015, this Kavalan Solist Vinho Barrique was matured in casks which previously kept red or white wine.
The distillery, from Taiwan, has been making waves in the whisky industry taking home the gold at the World Whiskies Awards for the best single malt 2015. Quite the accolade...

This limited edition Macallan was created in partnership with The Whisky Shop.  It was originally released as part of the 1700 series for the Travel Retail market.  It was discontinued in 2012 and has become a sought after bottling.

This Springbank 12 Year Old Decanter an absolute classic. This black decanter is typical of the era of release.
Becoming rarer by the minute and a great buy if you love a lowland whisky!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Distillery Excluisve - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of Bowmore's Fèis Ìle distillery exclusive releases of 2019.  It was created through a marriage of some of their finest bourbon casks.  The 15 year old single malt has notes of oak spice and bergamont balanced with the sweetness of candied orange shortbread.  This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 321.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: House of Commons - 8 Year Old - Signed by Tony Blair
DESCRIPTION:
This House of Commons 8 year old blend has been signed by the once Prime minister of Great Britain - Tony Blair.  This vatted malt is the result of a blend of 3 highly regarded malts.  It was distilled, cask matured and bottled by James Martin & Co.
The signature reads: 'Best Wishes Tony Blair'

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Distillery Excluisve - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of Bowmore's Fèis Ìle distillery exclusive releases of 2019.  It was created through a marriage of some of their finest bourbon casks.  The 15 year old single malt has notes of oak spice and bergamont balanced with the sweetness of candied orange shortbread.  This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 723.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years!
This classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan Distillery.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Glenrothes special bottling was distilled in and then bottled in the year 2000.
Approved by R.H Fenwick on 3rd September 1998.
Checked by J.L Stevens on 23rd May 1987.

This is a single cask release of Bruichladdich - this is one of only 281 bottles released by Islay House during Fèis Ìle 2018.
This 10 year old single malt was distilled at Bruichladdich in February 2008 and held in cask #17/154-16.  This special whisky was 4 x matured - firstly in bourbon casks, then Oloroso, followed by PX sherry, and then finally it was returned to bourbon.

This is a 2017 Fèis Ìle Festival bottling from Bowmore Distillery. It has been matured for 11 years in Oloroso sherry and Bordeaux wine casks. It was bottled at cask strength.  This is a limited release of only 2000 bottles.   
This is bottle number 1326.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks - The Macallan Concept

This single cask release was distilled, matured and bottled at Bruichladdich for Isay House and was released during Fèis Ìle 2017 by Islay House.  The single malt was distilled in May 2006 and matured in single French Oak cask #434. This is one of 325 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 117.

This distillery exclusive bottling was distilled in 1994, matured in bourbon cask #022 and finished in a Chateau d`Yquem cask.  It was bottled at the cask strength of 55.3% ABV in 2008. This is one of just 420 individually numbered bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 39.

The Micro-Provenance series was bottled exclusively for online releases - it is a unique series of individual cask bottlings.
This 2003 vintage Bruichladdich was filled into a port hogshead cask #15/297 543 in June 2003 and then bottled in November 2015 at 60.1% ABV.
 
This is bottle number 100 of 250 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 2004 - 10 Year Old - Rescue One Seven Seven - Micro Provenance
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask Bruichladdich was bottled for HMS Gannet SAR Flight Rescue One Seven Seven. Distilled in July 2004, it was aged in cask number 0678 for 10 years before being bottled in April 2015.
Royal Navy Sea Kings were involved in thousands of rescues since the first unit was established. The Scottish-based Royal Navy Search and Rescue Flight, HMS Gannet, has now finished its lifesaving mission after over 40 years of operations from Prestwick Airport.

A limited-edition single malt whisky from The Glenlivet's Master Distiller, Alan Winchester.  The Glenlivet Cipher comes in an opaque black bottle without cask information, tasting notes and age statement.  This bottle is surrounded by mystery.  You are encouraged to find the secret flavour hidden on the bottle label and visit the Cipher website for full tasting notes.

This is a set of five miniature bottles (5cl) by Highland Park.  This set contains:
Highland Park - 12 Year Old - 5cl - 40%Highland Park - 15 Year Old - 5cl - 40%Highland Park - 18 Year Old - 5cl - 43%Highland Park - 25 Year Old - 5cl - 48.1%Highland Park - 30 Year Old - 5cl - 48.1%
This set would is an ideal tasting pack or would be the perfect gift for a Highland Park fan.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

Signatory's bottling of Clynelish 1995 20 Year Old is a beautiful piece. Becoming more and more collectable over the years this specific bottle was distilled on 26th September 1995 and bottled on 18th August 2016.
The decanter collection is certainly for the esteemed collectors.
840 came from cask #8691.

The distillery is said to be the birthplace of distilling on Islay. The rich and intenseness of the flavours infuse the senses with delight.
A travel exclusive from the Islay company.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 13 Year Old - Moine Marsala - Handfill
DESCRIPTION: This single cask hand-filled bottling was sold exclusively the Distillery. Moine is the name given to heavily-peated Bunnahabhain.  This 13 year old was aged for 13 years including a finishing period in Marsala. This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery on 24th October 2018. It was bottled at the cask strength of 53% ABV.

Bruichladdich unique Micro-Provenance series is as a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This 12 year old is a limited edition of just 259 individual bottles.  It was matured in a sherry hogshead cask that was filled in May 2003 and then bottled on in November 2015.
 
This is bottle number 006.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Full Volume & Limited Edition 7" Vinyl
DESCRIPTION:
Full Volume by Highland Park was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017 from 481 casks.  The single malt was matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks and was bottled at 47.2% ABV and comes presented in a themed presentation box resembling speaker. 
This lot also includes a limited edition 7 inch vinyl single produced by Saul Davis - these special vinyl singles accompanied the first 1000 bottles sold.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 21 Year Old - Reserva Rum Cask
DESCRIPTION: The Glenfiddich 21 Year Old has been finished in casks used previously to age Caribbean Rum. This is an unusual finish from Glenfiddich here with an older expression. Described as exotic, rich and sweet dram.  Great for a Glenfiddich collector.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Limited Edition Tin
DESCRIPTION: This limited-edition Macallan 12 year old was exclusively matured in sherry seasoned oak casks, from Jerez.  It comes in a metal presentation tin featuring an image of a barrel shot by Magnum photographer Alex Soth.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

The distillery is said to be the birthplace of distilling on Islay. The rich and intenseness of the flavours infuse the senses with delight.
A travel exclusive from the Islay company.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This limited edition bottling is part of a pair of 1998 Sherry Editions from Bruichladdich. This whisky was distilled during a six week period in 1998, the only time the distillery was working between Jan 1995 and May 2001.  This 10 year old Bruichladdich was matured exclusively in Manzanilla sherry casks - that previously held dry, light and the freshest sherry from the Atlantic coastal town of Sanlucar.  This is one of just 6000 individually numbered bottles.
 
This is bottle number 2626.

This special limited edition release from Bruichladdich that was bottled without an age statement at 50% ABV.  It was distilled in 1988 and matured in 100% bourbon casks.  'Sinnsear' is Gaelic for 'Forefathers'. This is one of just 1,000 individually numbered bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 0958.

Port Charlotte PC6, produced by Bruichladdich, is a heavily peated spirit and is the second expression in their PC Series.
It was released at the cask-strength of 61.6% ABV. Distilled in 2001 and released in 2007 this 6-year-old whisky was limited to 18,000 bottles.  'Cuairt Beatha' is Gaelic for "Walk of Life".
This is bottle number 09,172.

This was the 9th release in the long-running Bruichladdich Links Series.  This 15 Year Old depicts a hole at Birkdale, England.
The whole links collection was done in a partnership with Graeme Baxter, a famous Golf Course artist.
 
This is bottle number 07,438.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

DESCRIPTION:
PHD_135: The lasting power of vision.
This was the 2016 Bruichladdich Feis Ile release - a 15 Year Old 2001 vintage. Matured in bourbon, wine and finished in virgin oak for one month. A limited edition of 1881 bottles....Absolutely stunning.
 
This is bottle number 0004.

This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

This limited edition Lagavulin 12-year-old is from Diageo's Special Releases- it is the twelfth of the series. It was vatted in refill American Oak casks before being bottled at natural cask strength.

Part of a pair of 1998 Sherry Editions from Bruichladdich - released alongside the Manzanilla edition from Bruichladdich's compare and contrast experiments.
This whisky was distilled during a six week period in 1998, the only time the distillery was working between Jan 1995 and May 2001.  This is one of only 9,000 bottles available.
This is bottle number 3,698.

Port Charlotte PC 11, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit which was originally sold as a Travel Retail exclusive. This is the seventh release in the PC series, released in 2013.
Scottish Barley in Gaelic is ‘Eòrna Na h-Alba’
This bottle is one of a limited run of 12,000 bottles was produced.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition was bottled at 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 14 Year Old - Royal Liverpool, Hoylake
DESCRIPTION:
This 14-year-old single malt was aged in Claret Wine casks and was the fifth release in the long-running Bruichladdich Links series. It depicts Royal Liverpool, Hoylake.
The Bruichladdich Links collection was created in a partnership with Graeme Baxter, a world-leading and internationally famous Golf Course artist. Each release in the series depicts a different golf course.
This is bottle number 35.

This 14 Year Old from Scapa Distillery was a shortlived bottling -it was introduced by Chivas Brothers to replace the old 12 Year Old, but was subsequently replaced by their 16 year old standard official bottling.

This bottling was released as part of the Bruichladdich Links collection. This 14-year-old single malt was the fourth release in their Links series and represents The Turnberry 10th Hole.
The Bruichladdich Links collection was created in a partnership with Graeme Baxter, a famous world-leading Golf Course artist. It is a series of releases, each features a different golf course.

Sienna is a no age statement bottling, released as part of the sherry matured 1824 Series from The Macallan.
Matured in top quality sherry casks, this single malt is named Sienna to represent the naturally occurring pigment - referring not only to the hue of this expression but to the fact that The Macallan's whiskies are all released with no added colouring.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Classic Travel Range
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the travel retail market, this single malt is part of The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition Classic Travel Range.  It was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky drawn from a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks.  It is bottled at his preferred strength of 42.8%. 
The range includes a set of 4 different bottle labels and outer boxes, with x-ray photography celebrating the art of travel, designed by Nick Veasey.
This lot is the 1930's propeller plane design which features both on the bottle lable and on the outer box.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore 06.1 - 5 Year Old - Scottish Barley
DESCRIPTION: One of the world’s most heavily peated whiskies, at 167ppm, this is the 6th edition of the very experimental Octomore. This sixth edition was branded 'Scottish Barley'.

Glenfarclas 21 Year Old is one of the most iconic Speyside drams - it is seen as a classic by many. It is heavily sherried dram, rich and full-bodied making it rank right up there with the best of Speyside malts.

Springbank 10 Year Old has been part of their core range for some time now. This is the older version but by no means inferior.
It was bottled at 100 proof (which is 57% in new money).
A vintage expression from Glenrothes, distilled in 1989 and bottled in 2002. A hugely popular bottle - all over the world, from this Speyside distillery.
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range. Becomes more and more desirable in the Asian markets, it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

2001 Vintage, Port Charlotte/PC12 (produced by Bruichladdich) is a heavily peated spirit.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929.
7th release in the series and 12 years old, this malt was made only for the Travel Retail Market.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 15 Year Old - Torrey Pines, USA
DESCRIPTION:
This 15-year-old single malt was the eighth release in Bruichladdich Links series and depicts Torrey Pines, USA. This single malt was finished in Chateau Latour casks.
The Bruichladdich Links collection was created in a partnership with Graeme Baxter, a famous Golf Course artist. It is a series of releases that each features a different golf course.
This is bottle number 12,175 of 18,000 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jameson - Limited Edition - St Patrick's Day 2013
DESCRIPTION: This is a special limited edition bottling of Jameson, with a celebratory label designed by David Smith - it was released for St Patrick's day 2013.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenAllachie - 13 Year Old - Spirit of Speyside 2019
GlenAllachie - 10 Year Old - Spirit of Speyside 2019

DESCRIPTION:
This exciting release by Wolfburn distillery was both their first-ever small-batch Wolfburn and the first time the distillery has created a lightly peated spirit.  This single malt was matured in 100 litre first-fill ex-bourbon casks. The name comes from where these little rascals were matured: warehouse 1, stow 28. Batch No.128 is a release of 6,000 bottles. 
 
One of only 6000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore 06.1 - 5 Year Old - Scottish Barley
DESCRIPTION: One of the world’s most heavily peated whiskies, at 167ppm, this is the 6th edition of the very experimental Octomore. This sixth edition was branded 'Scottish Barley'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore 06.1 - 5 Year Old - Scottish Barley
DESCRIPTION: One of the world’s most heavily peated whiskies, at 167ppm, this is the 6th edition of the very experimental Octomore. This sixth edition was branded 'Scottish Barley'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - PC 7 - Sin An Doigh Ileach
DESCRIPTION:
Port Charlotte PC7, produced by Bruichladdich Distillery, is a heavily peated spirit. Distilled in 2001, aged for 7 years in oak casks PC7 was released in 2008.
This is a limited bottling of 24,000 bottles. 
This is bottle number 13,465.

This is a 9 year old single malt from Bruichladdich, released as part of their Micro-Provenance Series.  A single fresh bourbon cask (#060) was filled on the 1st of March 2006 and was then bottled in July 2015. Only 273 bottles were produced.
The Micro Provenance web exclusive range comprises an exploratory series of single cask bottlings, hand-selected by Jim McEwan & Adam Hannett to showcase the complexity and pedigree of individual casks.
 
This is bottle number 72.

Now hugely sought after now that it has been discontinued. The Glengoyne 18-Year-old has now taken over this run.
In the quiet secluded glen beneath the hill of Dumgoyne, Glengoyne distillery captures the essence of the soft air and the cool streams.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold - Limited Edition with 2x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
A stylish Macallan gift pack.  It contains a 70cl bottle of the Gold expression from their 1824 Series, and two limited edition branded Macallan Whisky tumblers. 
The Gold was introduced as an alternative to Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak is at the thte light end of the colour/flavour spectrum.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - Valinch 0.3  - Tina Mackinnon - 12 Year Old - 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
This is a distillery exclusive hand bottling from Bruichladdich distillery.  This Port Charlotte Laddie Crew Valinch was released in honour of the Bottling Hall supervisor Tina Mackinnon.
The Port Charlotte single malt was distilled in 2001, matured in a French oak cask (No.854) and bottled at 12 years old, all at Bruichladdich Distillery.
This is one of just 400 individually numbered bottles,
This is bottle No.002.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 9 Year Old - Renaissance - Fèis Ìle 2011
DESCRIPTION: The Renaissance from Bruichladdich was distilled in September 2001 and was bottled at 9 years old for Fèis Ìle 2011. The maturation period was in a bourbon cask and 2,500 bottles were produced.

Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old from the 1980s, this is an old-style bottling from Islay.
With milder tones, this would be an ideal introduction to the Islay malts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2008 - Moine French Oak Finish - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of three releases by Bunnahabhain for the 2019 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt was distilled on the February 2008 and was matured for 11 years - it was finished in French Oak before it was bottled at 57.4% ABV in February 2019.  This is a limited edition release of only 1872 bottles produced.
Bunnahabhain is generally regarded as the lighter of the Islay whiskies, although the Moine releases are their heavily peated spirit. This particular example has been finished in French Oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - PC9 - An Ataireachd Ard
DESCRIPTION:
Port Charlotte/PC9 (produced by Bruichladdich) is a heavily peated spirit.
This malt is very much about the sentimental value in remembrance for the lost distillery at Port Charlotte on Islay. It closed in 1929.  'An Ataireachd Ard' is Gaelic for 'The Surge of the Sea'.
Distilled in 2001 and released in 2010, this 9-year-old whisky was limited to just 6,000 bottles.

The Macallan Select Oak is part of Macallans Travel Retail Range - The 1824 Collection. This single malt whisky was aged in a broad and unique combination of five cask types.  It is a lighter style of Macallan with sweet notes of butterscotch and vanilla.

This is a rare bottling of 1971 vintage Glen Grant 5 Year Old.  This whisky dates back to a time when five-year-old bottlings were prevalent.  The older styles of bottlings of Glen Grant are becoming increasingly hard to find.
This lot comes with a Glen Grant decanter.

This is the second edition of the Dalmore Cigar Malts as the original Dalmore Cigar Malt was discontinued in mid-2009.  It has since been relaunched in an eye-catching red box. The body, structure and character of this Dalmore Cigar Malt is said to be the perfect complement to a fine cigar.

This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.
This is bottle is an import.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 12 Year Old - Ancien Regime - Fèis Ìle 2011
DESCRIPTION:
Released for Fèis Ìle 2011, Bruichladdich 1998 Ancien Regime was distilled in 1998 under the previous ownership. It was a limited release with only 2,500 bottles and was matured in bourbon casks.  The release was one of two, to mark the acquisition and rebirth of Bruichladdich distillery.
This is bottle number 1,749.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas -  21 Year Old  - Royal Salute - Ruby Flagon
DESCRIPTION: A special Ruby-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 year old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 12 Year Old Distillery Exclusive - Bourbon Cask

DESCRIPTION: This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with presentation tin tube.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Sapphire Flagon

DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barrel Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon.  Dumped Date. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labelled, hand-sealed and individually numbered. 80 Proof.
Bottle Number 68

This 8-year-old was originally released for the Travel Retail Market in early 2016. Port Charlotte 2007 CC:01 is a peated expression from the Bruichladdich distillery which has been fully matured in French oak casks (Quercus Robur) that previously held French Eau De Vie, from the western Cognac region.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.
Macallan Gold in a beautiful presentation box complete with an Oak stopper. Ernie Button is a photographer that has started to work with Macallan a lot due to their similar nature in style.

A fully organic Bruichladdich 2003 - a century ago most barley was organically grown; natural fertilisers – seaweed, peat and manure – were harnessed in a way that respected the year’s agricultural cycle. 2003 was a particularly fine harvest of Chalice barley for William rose at Culblair Farm. Supreme quality barley combined with a slow trickle-distillation to do it justice, and new oak has resulted in Bruichladdichs creamiest release yet.  This is a limited edition release of 15,000 numbered bottles and Bruichladdichs first organic release - The name means 'In the Traditional Way.'

Jura 19 Year Old The Paps
Whisky and these hills must be the two most famous things on this beautiful Island. This 19-year-old expression was matured in a combination of American white oak ex-bourbon barrels and finished casks that previously held 30-year-old PX sherry.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Sapphire Flagon

DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

This is a very nicely presented bottle of 21-year-old blended whisky from Whyte & Mackay, which is believed to be produced in the 1980's. The bottle comes with a metallic tag that hangs from the neck of the decanter. It also comes in a beautiful silky lined, wooden presentation box.

This 10-year-old Highland single malt was distilled at Glenmorangie in Tain and bottled in 1993 in celebration of the distillery's 150th anniversary.
It comes with a handsome old fashioned gift tin, the bottle's rear label is illustrated by Mashman George Mackenzie.

This is a very nicely presented bottle of 21-year-old blended whisky from Whyte & Mackay, which is believed to be produced in the 1980's. The bottle comes with a metallic tag that hangs from the neck of the decanter. It also comes in a beautiful silky lined wooden presentation box.
