The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.
An older bottling of single malt from the famous Glenfiddich distillery in the heart of Speyside. This is the last 75cl bottles to be sold in the UK by Glenfiddich.
Sandeman 1966 Vintage Port is made from the richest grapes and usually from the most exceptional years. Fortified and then aged for two years in Oak Vats.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

From the Speyside distillery, Glenfiddich, this is their Experimental Series. The single malt was finished in bespoke craft IPA barrels. This pioneering malt is imbued with unique zesty citrus notes and the subtle tang of fresh hops.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

Balvenie 10 Year Old Founder's Reserve created by the master blender David Stewart by combining bourbon casks and sherry butts.
One of The Balvenie's core range since the early 1980s.
This Bottling is now discontinued.

A classic version of the 12-year-old expression by Glenlivet. The distillery was the first in the Highlands to be granted a license under the act of 1823.
They say their secret is the crystal clear water and the Highland air.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, Triple Cask Matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling is now discontinued.

This Dalmore 12 year old, is one of the older style bottlings.  This presentation of the Dalmore 12 is no longer available from the distillery. 
Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.

This bottling showcase the very first time Port Charlotte has been distilled exclusively from 100% Islay barley. Grown on six farms across Bruichladdich’s wild, Hebridean island – Coull, Kynagarry, Island, Rockside, Strachmill and Sunderland, the Port Charlotte Islay Barley is a heavily peated Bruichladdich at 40 ppm.  It has also been bottled using Islay spring water from the Octomore field of farmer James Brown.

This is a Dalmore 12 Year Old from the 1990s with the old style packaging.
This bottle has been matured in American white oak and Oloroso sherry butts.

This bottling Glenlivet 12 year old single malt is said to be from the 1980's.  It comes with a beautiful presentation tin depicting Royal Dornoch, one of Scotlands greatest golf courses. It was released as part of a 6 part series that each celebrates a Scottish golf course - including Turnberry, St. Andrews, Troon, Muirfield and Carnoustie. This is a 75cl bottling.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.
This malt is often considered the flagship expression from Clynelish Distillery - the successor to Brora Distillery which closed in 1983. This is a well rounded Highland malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!
This is a wonderful old official bottling of Tomatin 10 year old, with an understated black label. It is estimated that this bottle dates from the 1980s.

Einar is from Highland Park's travel retail Warrior series.  It is named after Einar Sigurdsson who is documented in the Orkneyinga Saga as 'hard and successful man' that once ruled Orkney, where the Highland Park distillery resides.  This single malt has been matured in Sherry seasoned American and European oak casks.  Warm flavours of zesty dried orange peel and vanilla pods sweetly unfold in each dram of Einar.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glengoyne - 10 Year Old - Art of Glengoyne
DESCRIPTION: A collectable Glengoyne 10 year old, released for Christmas 2011. The "Art of Glengoyne" special edition bottling comes with an eyecatching tin, that depicts a painting of the distillery, capturing "the tranquillity and beauty of Glengoyne and its location".

Mortlach - Rare Old was the first available release in the Mortlach range. The  Rare Old expression has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks and balances distillery character with cask influence. This is a 50cl bottling.
The bottles for this range are designed to reflect Victorian engineering designs in a tribute to one of the key figures in Mortlach's history, George Cowie, a civil engineer.

Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.

Macallan Gold was released in late 2012 as part of a series of colour-themed bottlings introduced to replace the distillery's age-statement expressions. Produced from 9-15yo first fill and refill sherry casks, it was designed to sit between the now-defunct 10yo Sherry Oak and 10yo Fine Oak bottlings.

Highland Park Saltire Edition 2 is a 13 year old single malt whisky.
A great partnership between F1 legend David Coulthard and Highland Park, to reflect his 13 Grand Prix wins.
"David collaborated with us to create a whisky that would enable him to give something back to Dumfries and Galloway, to the region and the people who supported him from his earliest days in Formula 1."
This 2003, 75cl bottling from Cragganmore was released as their 'Distiller's Edition.'  Distilled in 1990, the single malt was finished in Port casks.

This Macallan 11-year-old single malt was bottled by Bennachie Scotch Whisky Co. Ltd exclusively for Glenalmond Whisky Syndicate.  This 'Cask 32' single malt is presented in a dumpy 70cl bottle - it is hard to find Macallan bottling.

This bottling by Bruichladdich showcases the distillery's commitment to try and source as much barley as possible from Islay.  The 2006 vintage of Bruichladdich Islay Barley comes from Chalice barley grown on Dunlossit Farm; harvested in September 2006 and distilled November 2006.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has since been discontinued.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Gordon Highlander - 12 Year Old - St Andrews Golfing Decanter (1L)
DESCRIPTION: This Gordon Highlander ceramic decanter features St Andrews and contains 12 year old single malt distilled at the Tomatin Distillery.

Another superb cask-finished whisky from Glenmorangie as part of their Legends range, this time using Amontillado sherry casks. This offering was previously only available at travel retail, though luckily a few bottles have made it onto our shelves. Glenmorangie the Tayne takes its inspiration from the legend of a Spanish man-o’-war ship that was wrecked off the coast close to the distillery. The whisky seeks to recreate the profile of a “Spanish treasure”. This whisky takes Glenmorangie’s classic floral, biscuity flavours, and adds another layer of sherried complexity. Amontillado is a type of sherry typified as being darker than Fino but lighter than Oloroso, with an excellent balance between the dry and sweet characteristics of both sherries.
It was, of course, immortalised by Edgar Allen Poe in his classic gothic short story, The Cask of Amontillado. There are no horror stories here however, with Glenmorangie the Tayne being a superb whisky, with excellent, sophisticated flavours of dry wine, almonds and honey. This whisky is bottled at 43%, and in a litre size.

This Dalmore 12 year old, is one of the older style bottlings.  This presentation of the Dalmore 12 is no longer available from the distillery. 
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.
An older bottling of single malt from the famous Glenfiddich distillery. This bottle comes in a gift set along with 2 x crystal glasses.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: American Eagle - 12 Year Old - Tennessee Bourbon Whiskey
DESCRIPTION: American Eagle 12 Year Old is made from a marriage of corn, rye and malt, produced in Tennessee, USA.  The whiskey was aged in oak casks then bottled at 43% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

Aberfeldy, Macduff, Royal Brackla, Craigellachie and Aultmore are the five different malt and grain whiskies that make up this dram.
Dewar's 18 year old was matured in these different locations in Oak casks.

This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.

A limited release from Bowmore in a 9 Year Old Sherry and Bourbon Cask.
Lots of interest regarding this bottle due to the unusual age statement.
The No.1 Vaults bringing another surprise for the Islay lovers!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 13 Year Old - Gordon & Macphail
DESCRIPTION:
This is an independently bottled Caol Ila 13 Year Old by Gordon & MacPhail, released as part of a their "Discovery" range.
It was introduced in 2018.  The embossed glass certainly adds to its expensive feel.
This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with presentation tin tube.

Auchroisk Distillery is located in Banffshire Scotland - in the Speyside region.
'The Singleton' from Auchroisk Distillery is a 10 Year Old whisky that won multiple gold awards between 1989 and 1994.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bailie Nicol Jarvie - Old Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: This 'Very Old Reserve' blend is from Nicol Anderson & Co LTD, Queen's Dock, Leith. It is made up of malt sourced from the Highlands, Lowlands and Islands of Scotland with all whiskies used being over 8 years old.

This is an eye-catching older style bottling of Pinwinnie Royale Deluxe Blended Whisky.  It is very elegantly packaged with an iconic presentation tin. It is estimated that this botting is from the 1980s - unfortunately it is now discontinued.

An older official bottling of Royal Brackla Single Malt Whisky.
The Highland distillery is not very well known among the general public.  It has only come into the spotlight recently with a new core range being released.

This bottling by Bruichladdich showcases the distillery's commitment to try and source as much barley as possible from Islay.  The 2006 vintage of Bruichladdich Islay Barley comes from Chalice barley grown on Dunlossit Farm; harvested in September 2006 and distilled November 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - Hand Filled - 12 YO PX Butt 20cl
DESCRIPTION:
20cl of the finest Islay hand fill 12-Year-Old PX butt from Bunnahabhain. 
From Warehouse number 9 this is the whiskies natural colour and is non chill filtered.

Peated to a heavyweight 40ppm, Port Charlotte Scottish Barley is a cuvee crafted from cask profiles originally selected by master distiller Jim McEwan. It has been trickle distilled using only 100% Scottish Barley then matured in the village of Port Charlotte, before being bottled at the distillery using Islay spring water.  It is a dram full of depth and complexity; the flavourful peat & the smokey sweetness of the barley contrasts elegantly with the marine freshness of the spirit and the richness of toffee and vanilla.

This 50cl bottling produced under the Dunhill brand comes in a 'still' shaped bottles. It was created using whiskies from throughout the Highlands of Scotland and has been exclusively been matured in Oak casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Something Special - De Lux Scotch Whisky (1980's)
DESCRIPTION: This is a 75cl bottling of Something Special De Luxe Scotch Whisky. It is a blend from the House of Queen Anne and holds the Royal Warrant.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Appleton Rum - 1992 Estate Jamaica Rum X/V
DESCRIPTION: This is a vintage (1992) Appleton Estate Jamaica Rum, lithographed tin with hinged lid. The rum was distilled, hand blended and bottled in Jamaica. The tin was manufactured in England.
Distilled in 2000 and matured in refill American Hogsheads for 14 years, this Macduff single malt Scotch whisky was botted in 2014 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Connoisseurs Choice range.

This bottling of Bushmills Black Bush Special Old Irish Whiskey has become an increasingly collectable bottle of blended whiskey. It's made with whisky from Bushmills distillery in County Antrim and thought to have been bottled in the 1990s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Classic Malt Gift Set - Strong - Lagavulin, Talisker & Cragganmore (3 x 20cl)
DESCRIPTION: A set of three 20cl bottles that comes in a smart gift box presentation.  It contains a powerful combination of drams, great for hip flasks or as the perfect gift. This pack includes:

Grant's Royal 12 Year Old was loved by many around the world. It is estimated this bottling dates from the 1980s, a time when the brand still carried the name 'Royal'. It was botted at 86 US Proof and is a 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Classic Malts - Coastal Collection - Caol Ila, Clynelish & Talisker (3 x 20cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This gift set from The Classic malts range contains 3 x 20cl bottles of quality coastal whiskies from Islay, Highlands and the Scottish Islands. This set includes:
Caol Ila - 12 Year Old  - 20cl - 43%  Clynelish 14 Year Old - 20cl- 46% Talisker - 10 Year Old - 20 cl - 45.8%,

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
A lovely older style bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation tube.

This is a blend of over 15 single malts.  Originally, Gold Label was bottled at 18 years and labelled 'The Centenary Blend'.   However, this all changed in 2013, when Gold Label was revamped and replaced by a no-age-statement blend... 'Gold Label Reserve''.
This 10 Year Old Glenfarclas is a classic sherry aged single malt - it is a sweet, spicy and malty dram.
A 12 year old single malt from the Speyside distillery, Tormore.  Launched in 2004 this is the distillery's main official bottling.  Tormore is part of the Chivas Brothers portfolio of distilleries.

Talisker Storm was released in early 2013 as a no age statement whisky, which was matured in specifically selected refill and toasted American oak casks.  It has a very classic Talisker flavour profile and depth.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Whyte and Mackay - 12 Year Old - Masters Reserve
DESCRIPTION: A blend of a special selection of aged Speyside Malts left to marry in white American Oak casks.  This 12 year old blend has been matured for a richer and mellow taste.

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

This now non-agestatemnt single malt from Bruichladdich Distillery on Islay was finished Madeira casks.  When 'Waves' was repackaged Bruichladdich dropped its age statement and its peat level slightly.

The summer of 2010 saw the introduction of Fior from Fettercairn - a non-age statement bottling. This was partly tied in with the distillery going through a rebranding process.  'Fior' means 'pure' or 'true' in Gaelic.

Bunnahabhain Stiuireadair is a competitor for the 12 year old.
This bottling was matured in First and Second fill sherry casks of varying ages.

Bunnahabhain Stiuireadair is a competitor for the 12 year old.
This bottling was matured in First and Second fill sherry casks of varying ages.
Chivas Brother 12 Year Old from the 1980s. One of the top three grossing whiskies sold year on year.

This is an older style bottling of Danston 17 Year Old, that has been matured in oak casks.  It is a well-presented bottle - typical of one of the finest distilleries in Scotland.  It is a fine dram that has a lightly peated flavour with a sweet aftertaste.
This is a blend of Demerara rum from Guyana.  It is made from rum that was matured in Guyana before blending. This is a 1.5L bottle.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 10 Year Old - Second Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Peated to 40ppm and 10 Years Old this Port Charlotte has been matured in a first-fill bourbon cask, sherry cask, Tempranillo and french wine cask before being discontinued in 2013.
Released in late 2016, this is one of 18,000 bottles were ever produced.
This 10 year old is from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull.  This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Buchanan's - 15 Year Old - De Luxe Decanter
DESCRIPTION: This attractive decanter contains Buchanan's 15-year-old blended Scotch.

Gordon Highlanders scotch whisky is a blended whisky.  It is named after the Gordon Highlanders regiment of the British Army.  This bottling celebrates the Bicentenary of the Gordon Highlanders Regiment 1794-1994 which was named after the Clan Gordon.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 15 Year Old - Green Label
DESCRIPTION: Each malt whisky is matured for a minimum of 15 years blended to give Johnnie Walker Green Label a fresh and unique flavour.  The signature malts provide the key taste influences for this 15-year-old whisky. Talisker, Caol ILa  Cragganmore and Linkwood are more are expertly blended to make this award-winning blend.

This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range.  Jim Murray awarded this 15 year old 95 points in the Whisky Bible, recognising the quality of the dram for the price.
A single malt from a secret Highland distillery bottled under the name of the legendary Scottish loch 'Lochness' - 'a monstrously good malt!'

Nikka From the Barrel is a blend from The Nikka Whisky Distilling Co.  Matured malt grain whiskies from the Miyagikyo and Yoichi distilleries have been blended and recasked.  The blend won the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards in 2007 and 2010.
An assorted group of 5 x 5cl of miniature bottlings:

Johnnie Walker Double Black is a full-bodied whisky that is smoky with layers of spice.  It is inspired by the iconic Johnnie Walker Black Label.  It is strongly influenced by the powerful West Coast and Island whiskies.
Matured in a bourbon cask for 12 years at Balblair distillery, this release from Gordon & MacPhail has been released as part of their "Discovery Range".

The Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old is lightly peated - these milder tones make this an ideal introduction to the Islay malts.  It has been small-batch distilled, bottled at natural colour and is un-chill filtered.

This limited-edition bottling from Black Bottle was released to celebrate the 130th anniversary of the brand. Black Bottle was originally created back 1879 by a trio of brothers (David, Gordon and Charles Graham).  This bottling is now discontinued and becoming increasingly hard to find.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas Regal - 18 Year Old - Gold Signature
DESCRIPTION: This is a 70cl bottling of Chivas Regal 18 Year Old Gold Signature.  The packaging and bottling code indicate that it was bottled in 2010.

A sherry finished whisky from Tullibardine. 
After a long maturation in ex-bourbon wood, the whisky was finished in 500 litre Sherry Butts, which previously held Pedro Ximenez.
This is a 1993 Vintage.
Tomatin 10 Year Old bottled in the 1990's as you can see by the old-style label.
This is a highly acclaimed mystery single malt, that is praised for its value for money.  This is a limited edition release and a smooth Highland dram.

This is an older style bottling of Johnnie Walker Red Label, believed to have been released in the 1960s or 1970s.
Johnnie Walker Red Label was launched in its current form by brothers George and Alexander Walker in 1909, though it had existed as Walker's Special Old Highland Red Label for some years previously. Today it is one of the worlds most popular blends.
A lovely older style bottling of Glenmorangie 10 Year Old.
The Ileach Peaty (pronounced Eee-luhk) is a young and peaty single malt whisky from a secret Islay distillery, independently bottled by the Vintage Malt Whisky Company.

Gordon Highlanders scotch whisky is a blended whisky.  It is named after the Gordon Highlanders regiment of the British Army.  This bottling celebrates the Bicentenary of the Gordon Highlanders Regiment 1794-1994 which was named after the Clan Gordon.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old. 
This is a 20cl bottling.

An easy-drinking whisky by Richard Paterson, the creator of Sheep Dip.  Apparently this bottling gets its name from its smoothness likened to being 'as smooth as a pig's nose'. It's a blend with a high malt content and a youthful, fruity edge.
Tamdhu 10 Year Old is the first release in their maturing range of whiskies. Matured exclusively in sherry oak casks for 10 long years gives this Tamdhu bottling its glorious natural colour.

This 10 year old is an older style bottling from Glenkinchie Distillery, that comes presented in the famous orange box - with the classic malt stamp on the front of the box. The Glenkinchie 10 year old has since been replaced by the 12 year old.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in their core range for over 100 years!
This classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

This is the relatively more heavily peated version of the single malt, made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.
This bottling by Fettercairn is named after a country estate near to the distillery.  Fasque is the unpeated bottling from Fettercairn.
This is a core bottling from the Isle of Jura's only distillery. Aged in ex-bourbon casks, this 10 year old has the distillery's classic style.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in their core range for over 100 years!
This classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

A lightly peated single malt made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

A lightly peated single malt made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

A lightly peated single malt made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old. 
This is a 20cl bottling.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months. 
This is a 20cl bottling.

Johnnie Walker Sweet Peat is a special release blending using a base of malt from Caol Ila.
The Islay giant used whisky matured in refill casks, combined with other single malts from Glendullan and Cardhu.

Highland Park Dragon Legend
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.
Dew of Ben Nevis is a deluxe blended Scotch whisky from Ben Nevis Distillery.  All the whisky has been aged for over 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 12 Year Old - Wine Barrel Finish
DESCRIPTION: This Glen Moray 12 is an older expression from a distillery in Elgin, with a complex wine finish.
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin. A handsome relic of yesteryear.
A 10 Year Old Miltonduff, aged in sherry casks and bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.

This cider cask-finished Tullamore D.E.W. is thought to be the first of its kind - it is a marriage between the craft of small-batch cider-making and triple distilled Irish whisky. This expression packs a mighty punch of fruity notes right from the outset. This is a 50cl bottling with presentation box.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
A popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.
This classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

Kilchoman - Islay's farm distillery.
Machir Bay is a predominantly ex-bourbon influence on this release which is indicated in the cask influence graph on the front of the carton.
Sanaig has a predominantly Oloroso sherry cask influence. These aged oloroso casks contribute a drastically transformed depth of colour and character compared to the mostly Bourbon cask matured Machir Bay.
This is a lovely 12-year-old bottling from the Aberfeldy Distillery.  It comes with a presentation tube. This 12 Year Old is an excellent introduction to this Highland distillery.
Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
This is a bottle of Tormore Glenlivet 5 Year Old whisky. It is estimated that it was bottled in the 1980s.  It has a unique shape of a bottle sometimes referred to as the 'hand grenade' style.
This is a 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar Distillery. It is of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.

This single malt from the Tamdhu Distillery has no age statement. It has been suggested that this bottling was released in the late 80’s before Tamdhu became one of Edrington’s key sherry wood supplying distilleries.

Naked Grouse has been relaunched as a blended malt built on sherry-matured whiskies from Macallan and Highland Park.  Having won Gold in both Taste and Value from the Bartender Brand Awards 2018, this is said to be a must-try blended malt!

Monkey Shoulder is an excellent blended malt produced by William Grant and Sons, consisting of Glenfiddich, Balvenie and Kininvie.  
Each batch is produced from a small selection of 27 casks.
A popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

This is a no-age-statement release from Tomatin Distillery that uses virgin oak as well as bourbon casks. Itsis a new entry-level expression for the Tomatin range and the different casks used make this a unique expression.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Classic Malts of Scotland (6 x 5cl Miniatures)
DESCRIPTION: This lot contains 6 x 5cl bottlings in a gift pack.

This bottling of Special Old Irish Whiskey has become an increasingly collectable bottle of blended whiskey. It's made with single malt from Bushmills distillery in County Antrim and thought to have been bottled in the 1980s.
This set comes with 2 x black bush branded glasses.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 12 Year Old - Gold Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Famous Grouse 12 Year Old Gold Reserve has now been discontinued. It was released to celebrate a centenary of the Famous Grouse brand.  It is said to be of premium quality with a good proportion of malt whiskies (including Macallan and Highland Park) in the blend.

'Ancestor' is the successor of the classic 12-year-old blend from Dewars. It is is named double aged due to the additional 6-month maturation the whisky is given after the initial maturation and blending.
This is a 10 year old single malt from Benromach Distillery in Speyside. It was handcrafted by just 2 men, at what was Speyside's smallest distillery.

This is a global superstar endorsed blended Irish whiskey produced with the help of former Bushmills distillery manager David Elder.  A great marketing ploy as Proper Twelve, is of course not even close to twelve years old.  Proper No. Twelve takes its name from Dublin 12, the area where Connor McGregor grew up. 
It is described as rich and smooth having been triple distilled. We will let you decide for yourself!

Talisker Storm was released in early 2013 as a no age statement whisky, which was matured in specifically selected refill and toasted American oak casks.  It has a very classic Talisker flavour profile and depth.

This is a 10 year old single malt from Gordon & MacPhail's Benromach Distillery.  It was matured for the first nine years in 4/5 ex-bourbon and 1/5 ex-sherry casks and married for the tenth year in sherry casks.

A lightly peated single malt made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

Strathisla 12 Year Old is a Chivas malt. This malt is finished in ex-sherry barrels and is a highly commended fruity and sherry-rich Speyside single malt. In 2013 it had its packaging revamped to give it a fresh look.
An older bottling of The ‘Legend’ - a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore. We estimate this was bottled in the late 1990s.
A popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.
A lovely independent bottling of Tomatin. Matured in a Bourbon cask, filled in 2008 and bottled in 2018 by Gordin & MacPhail.  This is part of their 2018 release for the "Discovery" range.
This is an old no-age-statement peated Ledaig, distilled at Tobermory on the Isle of Mull.  Ledaig represents peated single malt from the distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dimple - 15 Year Old - Fine, Old, Original
DESCRIPTION: This is a 75cl bottling of Haig Dimple 15-year-old blended Whisky.  It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.
Made for the Spanish market, Immortal Memory Scotch Whisky was made to recognise the great work of Scots poet Robert Burns.  It was produced by Gordon & MacPhail.
Moidart 10 year old malt was bottled by William Cadenhead Limited.

A non-vintage from the Glenrothes distillery, selected by Glenrothes Distiller Jim Sutherland and Malt Master, John Ramsay.  The whisky was selected and vatted from casks from different years then married together in perfect harmony.  It has been produced to the same high-quality standards as The Glenrothes Vintage selections.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland. This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland. Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

Ardmore Traditional Cask is a double cask matured whisky. It was aged in bourbon barrels. The final maturation was in quarter casks to help enrich the whisky due to the smaller size of the cask type. It is a lightly smokey and rich Highland whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Black Bottle - Original Blend - Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: The very popular Black Bottle Scotch Whisky is heavy on the Islay malts. The newer version of this bottle is much milder, so if you miss the peat you better give this one a try.

An iconic old-style 50cl bottling of Glenmorangie 10 Year old with a rustic presentation tin.
Rollback the years with this Highland beauty, sometimes you just can't buy the history...but today you can!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Gold Signature - Gift Pack (with 1x Glass)
DESCRIPTION:
Chivas Regal 18 Year Old Gold Signature Gift Pack.
 
There is one glass missing from this set.

Released as a replacement for the sherry-finished expression, this Tomatin 12 Year Old has been aged in a bourbon cask and sherry casks. Bottled at 43% ABV, the result is a sweet whisky with notes of apples, citrus and sweet spice.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!
A popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old from Dufftown Distillery, in the heart of Speyside, has been matured in European and American oak casks. It was crafted using pure water from Highlandman John's well.
Winner of the Silver Medal at the International Spirits Challange in 2015 Abrachan Blended Malt.

Aged in Oak casks and bottled in Scotland, this bottle is from The Black Watch Distillers in Keith Scotland.
100% Whisky...just the way we like it!

This Lowland single malt whisky from the Auchentoshan distillery is a younger malt though certainly an enjoyable one.  'Classic' was launched in 2008 to replace 'Select'. It’s aimed to attract the new malt whisky drinkers.

Blended from the finest grain whiskies and matured in oak casks to deliver very light flavours on both the nose and palate, The Snow Grouse is a stand-out blend. It is meant to be served chilled to bring out its very best flavours.  This bottling is a cousin of the notorious Famous Grouse.

This is a no-age-statement single malt from Loch Lomond Distillery. Many of their expressions have won various awards with notorious industry bodies such as the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2016, World Whiskies Award 2016, and the Hong Kong International Wine & Spirit Competition 2015.

This book-themed presentation box contains a collection of Scotch whiskies from Invergordon Distillers. The Singles Bar set includes a tasting glass & 5 x 5cl whiskies.
These distilleries were all owned by Invergordon Distillers until 1993, when the portfolio was sold to Whyte & Mackay.

This is a bottle of the second release from the brand part-owned by David Beckham.  Haig Club Clubman is the entry-level bottling.  It is a single grain Scotch whisky distilled at Cameronbridge.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks, which gives sweetness as well as enticing vanilla and coconut notes & is designed to be enjoyed with cola.

The first official bottling of Tamnavulin for more than two decades. The Double Cask has been aged in American oak and finished in sherry butts. The result is a whisky with notes of dried orange, ginger and wood spice.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.
This is a 5cl miniature bottling.

This a Whyte & Mackay core bottling, at an unusual 13 years of age.  With the 13th and final year of maturation exclusively in sherry casks, it is unsurprising that this is a well rounded and rich blend,
This popular Irish whiskey has been triple distilled and aged 10 years. It was matured in bourbon and oloroso sherry casks for notes of honey, vanilla and ripe fruit.
Islay Mist Deluxe is a blend of aged whiskies - including Laphroaig Single Malt. Islay Mist retains the smoky flavour of Laphroaig whilst offering a beautiful softness.
This Ben Bracken 12-Year-Old single malt from Speyside was bottled by Clydesdale Scotch Whisky Co. Glasgow.
Glenfoyle 12 Year Old Highland single malt was exclusively selected for Tesco stores by Richard Paterson.
From Rother, a small town in the heart of Speyside, Speyburn produced this non-age statement Bradan Orach bottling. (Bradan Orach is Gaelic for Golden Salmon - the very best kind of salmon).

This bottling from Antiquary is a blend of some of Scotland's greatest 12-year-old malt and grain whiskies, including Royal Lochnagar, Tomatin, Cragganmore, Mortlach, Bowmore, Glenkinchie to name a few. Also, a quirky feature is that in the lid of this bottle box, there is a coaster that pops out!
'Ancestor' is the successor of the classic 12-year-old blend from Dewars. It is double aged due to the additional 6-month maturation the whisky is given after the initial maturation and blending.
This blended malt bottled by Glen Turner Company Ltd uses whisky that has been aged in Oak and Madeira Casks.
Whisky Galore is a 10 year old blended malt that includes whisky from all the major regions in Scotland.
Glen Grant 10 Year Old - a core expression from this popular Speyside distillery.
A unique blend of aged malt and grain whisky, from some of the finest whisky-producing distilleries in Scotland.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balvenie - 10 Year Old - Founders Reserve (5cl) + Glass
DESCRIPTION:
This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon casks and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

A half bottle of the iconic, medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig a particularly rich flavour.

The distillery was founded by a gentleman called James Allardice. He was not alone in his vision, local farmers helped him with funds for the building of the distillery. This Highland distillery produces some of the finest single malt years on year. This would miniature would certainly fit in well to any collection. 
The Glendranach Traditional 12-year-old!

The distillery was founded by a gentleman called James Allardice. He was not alone in his vision, local farmers helped him with funds for the building of the distillery. This Highland distillery produces some of the finest single malt years on year. This would miniature would certainly fit in well to any collection. 
The Glendranach Traditional 12-year-old!
Matured in a sherry cask.

The distillery was founded by a gentleman called James Allardice. He was not alone in his vision, local farmers helped him with funds for the building of the distillery. This Highland distillery produces some of the finest single malt years on year. This would miniature would certainly fit in well to any collection. 
The Glendranach Traditional 12-year-old!
Glenfarclas 8 year old 5cl miniature single malt whisky. From the heart of Speyside, this little tipple is a great talking point.

In 1797, in a small Scottish port, the whisky distillery of Oban was founded.
Their 14 year old single malt is now part of their core collection - this is a miniature 5cl bottling of it.
